episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including televised Microsoft Excel competitions, the World Poultry Congress, a man who stayed in bed for 30 years due to a fear of fresh air, and a Cameroonian folklore method for defeating chimpanzees.

facts.fact: In America, you can watch televised Microsoft Excel competitions.
In 1966, the World Chicken Congress happened in Kiev.
In the 18th century, a Worcestershire man called John Tallis stayed in bed for 30 years with a peg on his nose because he thought fresh air was dangerous.
According to Cameroonian folklore, the best way to beat a chimpanzee in a fight is to pretend to stab yourself with your weapon and then throw it at them.
